remarks: The set of functionals with closed kernels and majorizing the orthocomplement of a given subspace ` Q ` is a subspace of the dual space containing functionals with closed kernels.  Note that ` R ` is the value given by ~ mapdval .  (Contributed by NM, 12-Mar-2015.)
statement:
lclkrs2.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
lclkrs2.o $e |- ._|_ = ( ( ocH ` K ) ` W ) $.
lclkrs2.u $e |- U = ( ( DVecH ` K ) ` W ) $.
lclkrs2.s $e |- S = ( LSubSp ` U ) $.
lclkrs2.f $e |- F = ( LFnl ` U ) $.
lclkrs2.l $e |- L = ( LKer ` U ) $.
lclkrs2.d $e |- D = ( LDual ` U ) $.
lclkrs2.t $e |- T = ( LSubSp ` D ) $.
lclkrs2.c $e |- C = { f e. F | ( ._|_ ` ( ._|_ ` ( L ` f ) ) ) = ( L ` f ) } $.
lclkrs2.r $e |- R = { g e. F | ( ( ._|_ ` ( ._|_ ` ( L ` g ) ) ) = ( L ` g ) /\ ( ._|_ ` ( L ` g ) ) C_ Q ) } $.
lclkrs2.k $e |- ( ph -> ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) ) $.
lclkrs2.q $e |- ( ph -> Q e. S ) $.
lclkrs2 $p |- ( ph -> ( R e. T /\ R C_ C ) ) $.
